Nodes for arc-node topology.

Source: R/00_node.R
sc_node.Rd

Nodes are the vertices in the graph that are shared by "arcs".

sc_node(x, ...)

# S3 method for SC
sc_node(x, ...)

# S3 method for SC0
sc_node(x, ...)

# S3 method for default
sc_node(x, ...)

# S3 method for PATH
sc_node(x, ...)

# S3 method for ARC
sc_node(x, ...)

Arguments

x

input object
...

arguments for methods

Value

data frame of the nodes

Examples

sc_node(ARC(minimal_mesh))
#> # A tibble: 2 x 1
#>   vertex_
#>   <chr>  
#> 1 nDk9nX 
#> 2 lTPAh1 
sc <- SC(routes)
#> New names:
#> * `111` -> `111...11`
#> * `112` -> `112...12`
#> * `113` -> `113...13`
#> * `114` -> `114...14`
#> * `115` -> `115...15`
#> * ...
library(dplyr)
plot(sc)
#> New names:
#> * `111` -> `111...11`
#> * `112` -> `112...12`
#> * `113` -> `113...13`
#> * `114` -> `114...14`
#> * `115` -> `115...15`
#> * ...
sc_node(sc) %>% inner_join(sc$vertex) %>% select(x_, y_) %>% points()
#> Joining, by = "vertex_"
